de.weltraumschaf.jebnf.parser
Interface TokenAccess

All Known Subinterfaces:
Scanner
All Known Implementing Classes:
EbnfScanner
interface TokenAccess

Defines methods to access scanned input stream by tokens.

Author:
Sven Strittmatter

Method Summary
 void backtrackToken()
          Backtrack current token one token.
 void backtrackToken(int count)
          Backtrack current token n token.
 Token getCurrentToken()
          Returns the current scanned token.
 boolean hasNextToken()
          Returns if there are more tokens.
 void nextToken()
          Start the scanning of the next token.
 Token peekToken()
          Returns the next token without advancing the internal pointer (aka.
 

Method Detail

hasNextToken

boolean hasNextToken()
Returns if there are more tokens. This is always true if never nextToken() was called. No more tokens are indicated if the current token is of type TokenType.EOF.

Returns:
True if nextToken() will advance one more token.

nextToken

void nextToken()
               throws SyntaxException,
                      IOException
Start the scanning of the next token. This method should be called until hasNextToken() returns false.

Throws:
SyntaxException - On syntax errors.
IOException - On input stream IO errors.

peekToken

Token peekToken()
                throws SyntaxException,
                       IOException
Returns the next token without advancing the internal pointer (aka. lookahead). A call to nextToken() will return this token ahead.

Returns:
Return peeked token.
Throws:
SyntaxException - On syntax errors.
IOException - On input stream IO errors.

getCurrentToken

Token getCurrentToken()
Returns the current scanned token. May be null if never nextToken() was called.

Returns:
Returns always same instance until the current token is advanced by nextToken().

backtrackToken

void backtrackToken()
Backtrack current token one token.

backtrackToken

void backtrackToken(int count)
Backtrack current token n token.

Parameters:
count - How many tokens to back track.
